prompt.p: A 78-year-old woman presents with gradual onset of aching in both shoulders and both hips. Her erythrocyte sedimentation rate is 92 mm/hr (normal range 3â€“15 mm/hr). A diagnosis of polymyalgia rheumatica is made and treatment with prednisolone is recommended.
What is the major side effect of steroid therapy?

modalFeedback.p: Option C is Correct. Pancreatitis is a recognized complication of steroid therapy.
Option A is Incorrect. Steroids do not cause end-stage renal failure.
Option B is Incorrect. Steroids cause hypertension because corticosteroids have some mineralocorticoid effect with salt and water retention.
Option D is Incorrect. Steroids do not typically cause schizophrenia. They can cause insomnia, euphoria and mania. Depression can occur with steroid withdrawal after long-term use.
Option E is Incorrect. Steroids typically cause weight gain.
